mdRecord.dcterms:description: Lee provides his opinion on potential military promotions and raises a concern for the lack of discipline he is noticing within his army. Further, he faults unnamed brigadier generals for not instilling discipline or modeling proper behavior in camp that promotes it. He praises General George Steuart and ends with describing his observations of military action in and around Petersburg.
